page.title: 13METHWOLD MARKET
page.content: Methwold Market There has been a market in Methwold since Norman times, and in those days its main trade was in rabbit pelts. Nowadays the market is held every Monday in the Market Yard in the centre of the village, and people come from miles around.The market sells locally grown vegetables, live chickens,ducks and rabbits, household items, furniture, electrical goods and timber. On Bank Holiday Mondays there is also a sale of antiques and more valuable items,and on these occasions a great number of people visit the market.
